member.name: P:Telerik.RadToolbarUtils.RadControl.UseEmbeddedScripts
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to use the embedded JavaScript files or not.
member.value: True if embedded JavaScript files are to be used; otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Use this property for debugging purposes or to apply any modifications to the JavaScript files.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.#ctor
member.summary: The default contructor for RadToolBar

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.FindControl(System.String)
member.summary: Searches the current naming container for a server control with the specified id parameter

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validation is performed when the RadToolbar control postbacks to the server.

remarks.para: By default, page validation is performed when a RadToolbar control is clicked. Page validation determines whether the input controls associated with a validation control on the page all pass the validation rules specified by the validation control.

You can specify or determine whether validation is performed on both the client and the server when a RadToolbar control is clicked by using the CausesValidation property. To prevent validation from being performed, set the CausesValidation property to false.
This property is commonly set to false for a reset or clear RadToolbar to prevent validation from being performed when the RadToolbar is clicked.

When the value of the CausesValidation property is set to true, you can also use the ValidationGroup property to specify the name of the validation group for which the RadToolbar control causes validation.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.ImagesDir
member.summary: Specifies an override location for the toolbar button images. By default RadToolbar looks for the image files inside its selected skin images folder. Using this property you can set a new location for the files that is independent of the skins.
member.remarks: If this property is left blank the default location for the button images will be inside the skin folder.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.UseFadeEffect
member.summary: Specifies wether to use a fading mouseover effect for the buttons (IE Only).
member.remarks: Only supported on Internet Explorer for windows.
member.requirements: Microsoft Internet Explorer v5.5 or later.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.DisplayEnds
member.summary: Specifies wether to display skin specific ends for the toolbar.
member.remarks: Useful when integrating RadToolBar with RadDock

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.SkinsPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative path of the folder containing the skins.
member.example: If the skin folder is located in the project root and is named "Skins" the SkinsPath property should be set to: "~/Skins". Then you can create subfolders for individual skins e.g. Skins/Gold, Skins/Classic etc.
member.value: A string specifying the relative path to the folder which contains RadToolBar skins. The default value is "~/RadControls/toolbar/Skins".
member.remarks: RadToolBar ships with a set of predefined skins which are ready to use. They are located in RadControls/toolbar/Skins.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.ContentFile
member.summary: The location (path + filename) of the XML content file used to populate the menu.
member.example:
This is an example content file.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <radToolbar> <Button ToolTip="New Document" CommandName="new" AutoPostBack="False" ButtonImage="new.gif" DisplayType="ImageOnly" /> <Button ToolTip="Open Document" CommandName="Open" AutoPostBack="False" ButtonImage="Open.gif" DisplayType="ImageOnly" /> <Button ToolTip="Save Document" CommandName="Save" AutoPostBack="False" ButtonImage="Save.gif" DisplayType="ImageOnly" /> <Separator /> <ToggleButton CommandName="toggle" AutoPostBack="False" DisplayType="TextOnly" Enabled="True" Width="90px" Toggled="True" ButtonText="toggle button" Visible="True" /> </radToolbar>

remarks.para: RadToolbarButton class is serilized to a <Button> element.
RadToolbarToggleButton is serialized to a <ToggleButton> element.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.DataSource

summary.para: Specifies the data source to be used during data binding.

remarks.para: To bind a data source to a RadToolbar, you must first use the control's DataBind method to ensure data binding. The data source can either be of type IEnumerable, or it can be of type IListSource. If the data source is of type IListSource, you can use the DataMember field to specify which member to extract.

RadToolbar fully supports binding to collections, tables and datasets. Simply make sure you populate your collection from your data-source and set the DataSource property of RadToolbar to the instance of the the collection and call the DataBind() method. In addition, you can specify the ButtonTextFiled, ButtonCommandField or ButtonImageField of the data-source using the respective RadToolbar properties.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.DataMember
member.summary: If databinding to a dataset, this field indicates the table to bind data to.

remarks.para: This property is only used if the value of the DataSource property is of type IListSource, rather than of type IEnumerable.

To bind a data source to a toolbar, you must first use the control's DataBind method to ensure data binding. The data source can either be of type IEnumerable, or it can be of type IListSource. If the data source is of type IListSource, you can use the DataMember field to specify which member to extract.

member.summary: Specifies the default height of all child buttons. Can be overriden by setting the property.

member.summary: Specifies the default width of all child buttons. Can be overriden by setting the property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.SkinsDir
member.summary: Specifies the location of the skins directory. Normally you would want to leave this to the default.
member.remarks: If you change the default location of the RadControls folder, the value of this property is not updated automatically. You need to change its value manually.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.ValidationGroup

para.font: Note: This property is new in the .NET Framework version 2.0.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs.

member.value: The name of the validation group to which this validation control belongs. The default is an empty string (""), which indicates that this property is not set.
member.remarks: This property works only when CausesValidation is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.PostBackUrl

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL of the page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip is clicked.

member.value: The URL of the Web page to post to from the current page when a tab from the tabstrip control is clicked. The default value is an empty string (""), which causes the page to post back to itself.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.OnClick
member.summary: This event fires whenever a button is clicked on the client.
member.remarks: Note that you need to set the AutoPostback property to true.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.ItemAdded
member.summary: Fires whenever a button is added to the Items collection of the toolbar.
member.remarks: Note that you need to set the AutoPostback property to true.

member.name: E:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.ItemDataBound
member.summary: Fires whenever a button is being databound. You can use this event to bind additional properties to the dataitem provided.
member.remarks: Note that you need to set the AutoPostback property to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a brief phrase that summarizes what a control does, for use in ToolTips and catalogs of WebPart controls.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbar.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title of a WebPart control.

summary.para: Gets a string that is concatenated with the Title property value to form a complete title for a WebPart control.

remarks.para: The Subtitle property is used to return a default subtitle string for a WebPart control that is appended to the control's title in the title bar.

If you provide a default value for the Subtitle property in a control that implements the IWebPart interface, the Web Parts control set automatically appends it to the value of the Title property of the control at run time.

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL to an image used to represent a Web Parts control in the control's own title bar.

remarks.para: The TitleIconImageUrl property provides a way to associate an icon with a WebPart control. The icon appears in the control's own title bar. For thematic consistency, application developers might want to make this icon similar to the image that represents the control in a catalog of Web Parts controls (the image referenced in the CatalogIconImageUrl property).
As it is implemented in the Web Parts control set, the TitleIconImageUrl property can be personalized by end users to change the image or icon that appears in a control's title bar.

summary.para: Gets or sets a URL to supplemental information about a WebPart control.

remarks.para: When you assign a URL to the TitleUrl property, the title of the control becomes a link. The purpose of this property is to provide a convenient way for end users to access additional information about a control. The additional information could provide copyright data, contact data, details about the creator of the control, or a summary of the control's purpose.

summary.para: Gets or sets the URL to an image that represents a WebPart control in a catalog of controls.

remarks.para: Web Parts applications often provide a catalog (or list) of controls that users can add to a page. The CatalogIconImageUrl property on a control contains the URL to an image that represents the control when it appears in a catalog.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbarButton.BubbleCommandName
member.summary: Specifies a command name to be used for bubbling events. This is used in the CommandEventArgs parameter for the RaiseBubbleEvent.
member.remarks: If this value is left unchanged (i.e. string.Empty) the toolbar control will not fire a bubble event when this button is clicked. Also, AutoPostBack property of must be set to True.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbarButton.BubbleCommandArgument
member.summary: Specifies a command argument to be used for bubbling events. This is used in the CommandEventArgs parameter for the RaiseBubbleEvent.
member.remarks: For bubbled events to work, AutoPostBack property of must be set to True.

member.name: P:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbarButton.CommandArgument
member.summary: Specifies a command argument to be used for bubbling events. This is used in the CommandEventArgs parameter for the RaiseBubbleEvent.
member.remarks: For bubbled events to work, AutoPostBack property of must be set to True.

member.name: T:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbarItemCollection
member.summary: A strongly typed collection of RadToolbar items.

member.name: M:Telerik.WebControls.RadToolbarItemCollection.Add(System.Object)
member.summary: Adds an item to the list.

code.title: [New Example]
code.description: Adding items to the toolbar in code-behind

code.title: [New Example]
code.description: Adding items to the toolbar in code-behind

example.code:
Dim button_new As New RadToolbarButton button_new.CommandName = "new" button_new.ButtonImage = "new.gif" button_new.ToolTip = "New Document"
Dim button_open As New RadToolbarButton button_open.CommandName = "open" button_open.ButtonImage = "open.gif" button_open.ToolTip = "Open Document"
Dim button_save As New RadToolbarButton button_save.CommandName = "save" button_save.ButtonImage = "save.gif" button_save.ToolTip = "Save Document"
Dim separator1 As New RadToolbarSeparator
Dim toggle1 As New RadToolbarToggleButton toggle1.CommandName = "toggle" toggle1.Toggled = True toggle1.DisplayType = RadToolbarButton.ButtonDisplayType.TextOnly toggle1.ButtonText = "toggle button" toggle1.Width = Unit.Pixel(90)
toolbar1.Items.Add(button_new) toolbar1.Items.Add(button_open) toolbar1.Items.Add(button_save) toolbar1.Items.Add(separator1) toolbar1.Items.Add(toggle1)

summary.para: Removes all items from the list.
